content:
• Monday, February 5, 2018
  • CS

    Credit Suisse down more than 6% as short vol ETN collapses

    • The Credit Suisse VelocityShares Daily Inverse VIX Short Term ETN (NASDAQ:XIV) has plunged 85% in after hours action. Credit Suisse (NYSE:CS) is the creator of the vehicle, and also its largest holder - with 4.79M units rapidly heading to zero in value (after being worth nearly $600M at the start of the day).
    • CS is lower by 6.1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 PM | 101 Comments

  • Ugly action continues overnight: S&P 500 down another 1.4%

    • S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) futures are lower by 1.4%, adding to the regular session's 4.1% tumble. DJIA (NYSEARCA:DIA) futures are down 1.8%, and Nasdaq 100 (NASDAQ:QQQ) 1.1%.
    • In Tuesday action in Asia, the Nikkei (NYSEARCA:EWJ) is down a full 5%, and Shanghai (NYSEARCA:FXI) 1.9%.
    • The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield has pulled back to 2.69% from as high as 2.87% earlier this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 PM | 183 Comments
  • JNJ

    Wells Fargo: Worries about JNJ talc litigation overblown

    • A note from Wells Fargo attributes part of today's drop by Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) not just on the market decline, but also on concerns over talc litigation.
    • But those worries are overblown, analyst Lawrence Biegelsen says, crunching the numbers on liability.
    • There are 5,500 cases nationwide, he notes, and even if all of them settled for $280,000 each (the highest Wells has seen per case), that's total liability of $1.5B, vs. JNJ's $18.4B in cash and marketable securities.
    • Shares fell 5.3% during the regular session today and are up 4.5% after hours.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 17 Comments
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine +7% following better than expected quarterly results

    • Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST) +7.1% after-hours as it reports a smaller than expected FQ3 loss and a 13% Y/Y revenue increase, as the company says customers continue to adopt its low emission microturbine technology.
    • CPST says Q3 gross margin totaled $5M, or 22% of revenue, compared to a negative gross margin of $4M, or -20% of revenue, during the year-ago quarter, and adjusted EBITDA of $400K was in contrast to a year-ago EBITDA loss of $9.6M.
    • CPST says it booked $7.2M in net product orders during the quarter, compared with $5.8M received and booked in the prior quarter and $11.5M received and booked during the year-ago Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • MU

    Micron updates Q2 guidance, appoints CFO

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) updates its Q2 guidance to revenue of $7.2B to $7.35B (prior: $6.8B to $7.2B; consensus: $7.02B).
    • EPS updates to $2.70 to $2.75 (prior: $2.51 to $2.65; consensus: $2.57). 
    • Micron also announces the appointment of David Zinsner to SVP and CFO, effective Feb. 19. 
    • Zinsner replaces the retiring Ernie Maddock. 
    • Micron shares are up 0.6% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 209 Comments
  • SWKS

    Skyworks +2.9% on Q1 results, downside guidance, and $1B repurchase program

    • Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) shares are up 2.9% aftermarket following Q1 results that beat EPS estimates and met on revenue. 
    • Downside Q2 guidance: Revenue, about $902M to $919.83M (consensus: $943.33M; +6% to 8% Y/Y); EPS, $1.60 (consensus: $1.63; +10% Y/Y).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP operating margin, 39.4%; cash flow from operations, $361M; total operating expenses, $153.3M; cash and equivalents, $1.68B.
    • $1B repurchase program: Board authorizes the repurchase of up to $1B in common stock prior to January 31, 2020. The program replaces the $500M program authorized in January 2017, which had $2M remaining.
    • Earnings call scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release
    • Previously: Skyworks Solutions beats by $0.09, revenue in-line (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 27 Comments
  • FTNT

    Fortinet gains on double-digit Q4 revenue jump

    • Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) is up 2.5% after hours on solid volume, set to recoup most of the ground it lost today, after it posted Q4 earnings where it beat with revenues that jumped double digits from the prior year.
    • Revenues gained nearly 15% on the strength of service growth that neared 25%. Billings also gained 15% to $534M, and deferred revenue was up 29% to $1.34B.
    • The company swung to a net loss in GAAP terms of $0.17/share, after taking a one-time expense of $63M tied to the new tax legislation -- an effect of about $0.36/share.
    • Non-GAAP net income ticked up to $55.5M from $53.2M.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $161.1M (up 2%); Service, $254.55M (up 24.8%).
    • Free cash flow was up 65% Y/Y to $459.1M.
    • It's guiding to Q1 revenues of $387M-$393M (in line with consensus for $389.2M), billings of $449M-$457M, gross margin of 75-76%, operating margin of 12-13%, and EPS of $0.21-$0.22 (vs. consensus for $0.22).
    • For fiscal 2018, it's forecasting revenue of $1.695B-$1.715B (above consensus for $1.695B), billings of $2.03B-$2.05B, gross margin of 75-76%, operating margin of 17.7%-18% and EPS of $1.30-$1.32 (above expectations for $1.20).
    • A Q&A to follow its 4:30 p.m. earnings call will be webcast at 6:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIOA

    BioAmber readies readies equity offering; shares down 3% after hours

    • BioAmber (OTC:BIOA) commences a public offering of Series A units, each consisting of one share of common stock and one Series B warrant to purchase one share of common. Prices, volumes and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 3% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • PAHC

    Phibro Animal beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Phibro Animal (NASDAQ:PAHC): Q2 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $206M (+7.5% Y/Y) beats by $11.11M.
    • Shares +2.1%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • OCLR

    Oclaro +2.7% after Q2 beats despite falling revenue

    • Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) is up 2.7% postmarket, making up half of the ground lost with today's market session, after fiscal Q2 earnings that beat expectations despite declining revenues.
    • Revenues dipped both Y/Y and sequentially, but "the team again delivered strong gross margin, profitability and cash flow," says CEO Greg Dougherty. While he expects another quarter of down revenue, it should resume growth in the June quarter, he says.
    • Gross margin (non-GAAP) was 38.4%, down from a year-ago 39.8% and Q1's 40.6%.
    • Operating income fell to $24.5M from $36.2M.
    • Cash, equivalents and short-term investments were $290.1M as of Dec. 30.
    • For Q3, it's guiding to revenues of $120M-$128M (light of expectations for $132.8M), gross margin of 34-37% and (non-GAAP) operating income of $13M-$17M.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 7 Comments
  • GWPH

    GW Pharma fiscal Q1 top line up 179%; cash consumption up 65%

    • GW Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:GWPH) fiscal Q1 results ($M): Revenue: 7.7 (+178.8%).
    • Net loss: (63.3) (-201.3%); loss/share: (0.24) (-188.5%); cash consumption: (53.3) (-64.6%).
    • Data from Phase 3 tuberous sclerosis study and second Phase 3 in Dravet syndrome expected in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM

  • Selling continues after hours

    • S&P 500 futures have fallen anther 20 points, or roughly 0.75% since the 4 ET close, bringing the day's decline to 5.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 12 Comments
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine beats by $0.05, misses on revenue

    • Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST): Q3 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $22.76M (+12.8% Y/Y) misses by $0.22M.
    • Shares +3.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic plunges 10.9% after Q3 misses, downside guidance

    • Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) shares are down 10.9% aftermarket following Q3 results that missed EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Downside Q4 guidance: Revenue, $300M to $340M (consensus: $373.39M); gross margin, 48% to 50%. 
    • Key Q3 metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 48.8%; operating expenses, $107.9M; cash and equivalents, $226.6M. 
    • CEO Jason Rhode explains the weakness: "Unanticipated weakness in smartphone demand that materialized in late December drove our Q3 results below expectations and further impacted our Q4 guidance. Despite these near-term challenges, our design position remains strong at our top customers and our wide range of new and existing products are expected to drive exciting opportunities in audio and voice applications across the smartphone, digital headset and smart home markets over the next several years." 
    • Share repurchase: Board authorizes up to an additional $200M of common stock, in addition to the $60.2M remaining from the October 2015 authorization.  
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Cirrus Logic misses by $0.19, misses on revenue (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • LULU

    Lululemon CEO resigns

    • Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) announces that CEO Laurent Potdevin has resigned from the company after falling short of the standards of conduct expected by all employees.
    • A search for a new CEO is already underway.
    • Lululemon also reiterated prior guidance.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • LULU -4.45% AH to $74.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 16 Comments
  • GWPH

    EMA accepts GW Pharma's marketing application for Epidiolex for severe types of epilepsy; shares up 6% after hours

    • The European Medicines Agency (EMA) accepts for review GW Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:GWPH) marketing application seeking approval for Epidiolex (cannabidiol) for the adjunctive treatment of seizures associated with Lennox-Gastaut syndrome and Dravet syndrome, two rare forms of epilepsy.
    • A final decision by the European Commission should be announced no later than Q1 2019.
    • The company's U.S. application is currently under FDA review with an action date of June 27.
    • Shares are up 6% after hours.
    • Previously: GW Pharmaceuticals submits MAA in Europe for Epidiolex in the treatment of LGS and Dravet syndrome (Dec. 29, 2017)
    • Update: Shares are down 2% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSYS

    Stratasys brings 3D printing to prosthetic limb initiative

    • Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS), Dassault Systemes (OTCPK:DASTY, OTCPK:DASTF), and Easton LaChappelle announce a new Unlimited Tomorrow initiative to create custom-designed 3D printed prosthetic arms.
    • ”Unlimited Tomorrow re-thinks the way artificial limbs are made by targeting common pain points of customization, weight and cost.”
    • Easton LaChappelle founded the initiative while Stratasys and Dassault will provide 3D printing and CAD/CAE supplies, respectively.    
    • Stratasys shares closed today down 3.6%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • XOM

    Energy sector slammed; oil prices hit by global market jitters

    • The energy sector is one of the market's worst performers in a day filled with awful performers, with the Energy Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLE -4.2%) at one point posting its biggest one-day decline since January 2016 and following Friday's 4% thrashing.
    • Exxon Mobil (XOM -5.7%) is in the midst of a ~10% loss over two trading days, while the sector drowns in a sea of red: CVX -5.3%, BP -4.4%, MRO -4%, COP -3%, APC -3.4%, HES -6%, OXY -3.2%, VLO -3.8%, KMI -3.5%, EPD -2.8%, ETP -2%.
    • Among the fundamental reasons - aside from the selling wave that has washed over Wall Street today - are a stronger dollar and rising U.S. crude production, as tailwinds for oil markets in recent weeks “have become headwinds, including the U.S. dollar bottoming out, and storage drawdowns turning into inventory builds,” says Colin Cieszynski of the Canadian Society of Technical Analysts.
    • "When something becomes too good, we know it’s about to end in tears," warns Ole Hansen, head of commodity strategy at Saxo Bank. "And the market has almost become too perfect in the last few months."
    • U.S. WTI crude settled today -2% loss at $64.15/bbl, marking its lowest finish since Jan. 22, and Brent crude ended -1.4% to $67.62/bbl, ending at a roughly four-week low.
    • ETFs: USO, UNG, XLE, OIL, UGAZ, UWT, DGAZ, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, BOIL, GASL, FCG, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, KOLD, DRIP, IEO, FIF, UNL, GASX, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, DCNG, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, GAZB, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 52 Comments
  • ON

    Semiconductor slump on Morgan Stanley concerns, Qualcomm news, ON earnings

    • Semiconductors slump heading towards today’s close after ON Semiconductor’s (ON -4%) earnings report and news that Qualcomm (QCOM -5.8%) has a final offer from Broadcom (AVGO -1.4%) and could miss out on supplying the next iPhone.
    • Morgan Stanley was also out with a note that downgraded the tech sector and said chip stocks are at risk from poor iPhone sales and rising inventory levels. 
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is down 2.6%. 
    • Other semiconductor shares on the move: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD -8%), Cypress Semiconductor (CY -7.4%), Maxim Integrated (MXIM -2.3%), Teradyne (TER -1.9%), Lam Research (LRCX -3%), STMicroelectronics (STM -1.1%), Xilinx (XLNX -3.6%), ASML (ASML -2.3%), Micron (MU -2%), Analog Devices (ADI -2.6%), Cirrus Logic (CRUS -3.1%), Seagate Technology (STX -2.6%).        
    • Semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
    • Previously: ON Semiconductor reports Q4 beats, upside guidance (Feb. 5)
    • Previously: Broadcom confirms $82 per share offer for Qualcomm (Feb. 5)
    • Previously: Apple supplier optimistic on iPhone 8 demand; Intel replacing Qualcomm modems? (Feb. 5)
    • Previously: Not ready to buy dip, Morgan Stanley downgrades tech, boosts utilities (Feb. 5)
    • Previously: Morgan Stanley: RF chip stocks feel pressure from weak iPhone sales (update) (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 70 Comments
  • VIA

    Report: Viacom to buy VidCon in influence-marketing push

    • Viacom (VIA -2.5%, VIAB -2.6%) is buying VidCon, which puts on an annual event for video loggers, TheWrap reports.
    • The company had bought WhoSay last month, another move in a push into influencer marketing.
    • This year's U.S. VidCon is set for June 20-23. Jim Louderback, named VidCon CEO in August, will stay on to run the company after the purchase.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • EL

    S&P 500 outliers still in the green

    • Only about a dozen stock in the S&P 500 Index are up for the day as afternoon selling piledrives through the market.
    • Today's outliers include Church & Dwight CHD, up 2.77% after strong earnings, as well as Estee Lauder (NYSE:EL) and Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI), both up about 0.80%.
    • Another stock holding its ground is Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN), up 0.61% on some confidence from analysts that the long-term thesis is still in play on the casino giant even with Steve Wynn in a reduced role.
    • Previously: Selling turns panicky; Dow down more than 5% (Feb. 5)
    • Previously: Consumer favorites routed along with rest of market (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 10 Comments
  • WFT

    Weatherford down another 11% as Tudor Pickering tags with Sell rating

    • Weatherford (WFT -11.6%) plunges to a 52-week low and has tumbled ~25% in the two days since posting a larger than expected Q4 loss and attempting to reassure investors that a turnaround is near.
    • Tudor Pickering, Holt downgrades WFT to Sell from Buy, saying "the magnitude of the disappointment - even assuming the business recovers - means it's hard for us to get excited about the story here."
    • WFT "maybe took multiple steps back," says Tudor Pickering's Byron Pope, adding that what once was the big four of energy services giants - along with Schlumberger (SLB -2.4%), Halliburton (HAL -3.4%) and Baker Hughes (BHGE -4.4%) - is "really more like the big three at the point... I don't even think it's fair to include Weatherford in that conversation anymore."
    • Among other firms, CFRA Research keeps its existing Sell rating and Evercore ISI warns "patience is running thin" on WFT.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 21 Comments
  • TMUS

    Verizon sees Super Bowl data use jump near 19 TB

    • In wireless indicators around an event that gets more "connected" each year, Verizon (VZ -3.3%) said it saw 18.8 terabytes of cellular data used at the Super Bowl, in and around Minneapolis' U.S. Bank Stadium.
    • It had reported 11 TB used at last year's championship game in Houston. Top use on Verizon was Web browsing, then streaming video and social media/sports apps.
    • AT&T (T -2.2%), meanwhile, said it saw 7.2 TB of traffic from its customers.
    • T-Mobile (TMUS -1.3%) says it won't report data use from the game.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 11 Comments
  • OSTK

    Cryptocurrency crunch sends Overstock.com lower

    • The falling price of cryptocurrencies is pulling Overstock.com (OSTK -10.3%) lower again.
    • Overstock.com trades at $50.60 vs. a 52-week trading range of $13.75 to $89.80.
    • Previously: Bitcoin breaks to new lows (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 36 Comments

  • Treasury yields tumble as panic hits equities

    • Up until a short while ago, fixed-income traders had mostly sat on their hands as equity markets sold off over the past week. The stock action, though, has turned rather panicky this afternoon, with the Dow's decline nearing 6% at one point (it's currently 3.5% lower).
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is now lower by 7.4 basis points to 2.768%. TLT +0.7%, TBT -1.4%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 25 Comments
  • KO

    Consumer favorites routed along with rest of market

    • Dow components Coca-Cola (KO -3%), Nike (NKE -3.1%), Visa (V -2.8%), McDonald's (MCD -3.5%) and Procter & Gamble (PG -3.1%) are being driven lower amid a huge downturn.
    • Media outlets are reporting that computer-driven selling pressure has accelerated the losses over the last hour.
    • Previously: Selling turns panicky; Dow down more than 5% (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 35 Comments

  • Selling turns panicky; Dow down more than 5%

    • A modest continuation of last week's selloff has morphed into something way more, with the DJIA down 1.3K points one hour before the bell.
    • The S&P 500 is lower by 4.4%, and the Nasdaq by 3.4%.
    • Into this steps Ray Dalio. The hedge funder may have top-ticked the market on Jan. 23 when - holding court in Davos - he said the average Joe was going to feel pretty stupid for holding cash. With the Dow down about 2.5K points since, Dalio today says the selloff is typical late-cycle behavior.
    • The decline may seem sizable, but is hardly a blip on a long-term chart, he adds, and there's plenty of cash on the sidelines waiting to buy.
    • ETFs: SPY, QQQ, DIA, VOO, SH, SDS, IVV, SSO, TQQQ, SPXU, UPRO, SPXL, RSP, SQQQ, SPXS, PSQ, VFINX, QID, QLD, UDOW, DOG, DXD, SDOW, DDM, EPS, QQQE, QQEW, BXUB, SPLX, SPUU, QQXT, BXUC
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 358 Comments
  • HAYN

    Haynes still higher following J.P. Morgan upgrade

    • Haynes International (HAYN +3.8%) has shed much of its earlier advance but is still higher after J.P. Morgan upgraded shares to Overweight from Neutral and raised its price target to $51 from $35.50.
    • Better activity levels in specialty application projects and market acceptance of higher pricing could be early signs of growing customer demand and stronger pricing ahead for HAYN, says JPM analyst Michael Gambardella, who believes the company is at a positive inflection point in its earnings growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • GRVY

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 pm (2/5/18)

    • Gainers: GRVY +9%. ENPH +9%.
    • Losers: DPW -24%. OTCPK:LFIN -13%. HIMX -11%. GDS -11%. VECO -10%. OTC:PRKR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • XOM

    Exxon tanks 10% over two days in biggest rout in two-and-a-half years

    • Exxon Mobil (XOM -5.5%) is on course for its steepest two-day stock rout since August 2015, down 10% since issuing disappointing Q4 results and as crude oil prices drop.
    • “It’s a follow up trade from Friday, there’s nothing incremental that’s come out since the earnings call,” says Jefferies analyst Jason Gammel, whose firm rates XOM at Hold. “There were pretty weak cash flow numbers. It was a pretty big miss.”
    • XOM has seen several stock price target cuts from Wall Street analysts: Credit Suisse maintains its Neutral rating but cuts its target to $80 from $84 as it lowered earnings and production forecasts, Wells Fargo tweaked its price target to $87 from $88, and Jefferies trimmed its target to $87 from $90.
    • Meanwhile, BofA Merrill Lynch maintains its Buy rating and $102 price target, saying its investment case remains intact and the recent weakness presents an attractive buying opportunity.
    • Chevron (CVX -4.5%) also extends its Friday swoon amid several price target cuts: Wells Fargo maintained its Outperform rating but cut its target to $125 from $129, Jefferies kept its Buy rating but trimmed its target to $149 from $152, while BofA Merrill stays with its Neutral rating and $138 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 16 Comments

  • Bull market in volatility

    • With the Dow at the moment set to log its 2nd consecutive 500+ point decline, the VIX has more than doubled this year, and now sits above 25 for the first time since June 2016. The long-term average is about 20.
    • The iPath S&P 500 VIX Short-Term Futures ETN (NYSEARCA:VXX) is up 15.7% this session; the VelocityShares Daily 2X VIX Short-Term ETN (NASDAQ:TVIX) is up 33.6%, and is the market's most actively-traded ticker today.
    • ETFs: VXX, UVXY, XIV, TVIX, SVXY, VIXY, ZIV, VXZ, VIXM, VMAX, VMIN, VIIX, CVOL, XVZ, TVIZ, XXV, IVOP, VIIZ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 80 Comments
  • ON

    Analyst raises ON Semiconductor target to 18% upside

    • Craig-Hallum raises its ON Semiconductor (NASDAQ:ON) price target by $2 to $28, an 18% upside on Friday’s close, following the earnings report.
    • Firm cites strong positioning in automotive and industrial markets and growth avenues for multiple new and existing products that should drive better results throughout FY18. 
    • Mizuho raises its price target by a dollar to $27. 
    • Firm thinks the March quarter and FY18 could see continued momentum with automotive ADAS and SiC EV growing at a 25% CAGR and growths in industrial, handset, and server. 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • ON shares are down 2.8%.  
    • Previously: ON Semiconductor reports Q4 beats, upside guidance (Feb. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • JONE

    Jones Energy +7% after regaining NYSE listing compliance

    • Jones Energy (OTC:JONE +7.7%) surges after saying it regained compliance with continued listing requirements for the NYSE, which had warned the company in December that its stock had fallen below the exchange's $1 minimum threshold.
    • Jones says it cured its deficiency and regained compliance as of the close on Jan. 31 because the share price was above $1.00/share on the last trading day of January and was on average higher than $1.00 for the 30 trading days prior to Jan. 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • FOX

    'Jumanji' retakes top box-office spot for Sony, while 'Winchester' stands up

    • Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (SNE -3.5%) returned to the top spot at the box office after a one-week interruption from Maze Runner: The Death Cure (FOX +0.7%, FOXA +0.8%), now narrowly back to No. 2.
    • Jumanji added to its giant haul with $11M, to Maze Runner's $10.2M (the film suffered a 58% drop-off in business despite adding a few theaters in its second week).
    • Meanwhile, the only major film to brave Super Bowl weekend -- the historical/horror Winchester (LGF.A +0.2%, LGF.B +0.7%) -- narrowly finished at the No. 3 spot with $9.25M, just ahead of Fox's The Greatest Showman.
    • Jumanji has now goosed its domestic cumulative total past $350M and foreign total over $500M for a worldwide gross of $855.7M, in seven weeks of release. Meanwhile, Greatest Showman, also in its seventh week, has plugged along nicely to hit a worldwide cumulative total of $290.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • NHLD

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (02/05/2018)

    • Gainers: NHLD +6%.
    • Losers: MCY -10%. WFC -8%. ONDK -8%. LMFA -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • S

    KeyBanc goes Neutral on Sprint after earnings please to upside

    • Sprint (S -1.6%) has earned an upgrade from KeyBanc to Sector Weight, on grounds that the carrier's earnings report was "better than feared."
    • That's despite the fact that a few measures were short of consensus (while postpaid phone additions were a bit short, churn was in line).
    • Churn will likely peak in 2018 as investments take hold and moderate next year, says analyst Brandon Nispel. The company's likely this year to boost its cell sites by 20% after signing a couple of deals with major tower companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 45 Comments
  • PM

    Philip Morris takes margin hit in France amid higher taxes

    • Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) is taking a margin hit to protect market share in France after the nation adopted highest tobacco taxes.
    • Agence France-Presse reports that Philip Morris is raising prices by €0.70 on its Marlboro red and gold pack vs. an average price increase in the region of €1.00 per pack (per Bloomberg).
    • Shares of Philip Morris are down 2.0% on the day, a bit worse than the 1.3% decline of the S&P 500 Index.

Rupert Murdoch wanted to sell to Disney in part due to regulatory concerns with a company like Comcast, but a premium offer could convince enough Fox shareholders to vote against Murdoch, whose family owns just 17% of all outstanding shares.
    • With the Trump administration's opposition to the AT&T/Time Warner deal clogging possibilities for legacy media, Sherman writes, the FAANGs are free to run wild on content fed by their rising growth.

  • GOLD

    Randgold prepared to take legal action against new Congo mining code

    • Randgold Resources (NYSE:GOLD) is prepared to take legal action if a new mining code in the Democratic Republic of Congo becomes law, says CEO Mark Bristow.
    • The new code, which has been approved by the country’s parliament, would subject miners to new royalty charges as well as a 50% super profits tax and take effect immediately, removing a clause in the old law that exempted miners from complying with changes to the fiscal and customs regime for 10 years.
    • Bristow says he does not think DRC Pres. Kabila ultimately would approve the new code, which he says has been “taken over by a lot of short political interests” and state-owned mining company Gecamines.
    • Other international miners active in the country also campaigning against the new code include Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF, OTCPK:GLNCY), Ivanhoe Mines (OTCQX:IVPAF) and China Molybdenum (OTCPK:CMCLF).
